018package org.opengis.filter.capability;
019
020import java.util.Map;
021import java.util.Optional;
022import java.util.Collections;
023import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
024import org.opengis.util.LocalName;
025import org.opengis.util.ScopedName;
026import org.opengis.filter.Expression;
027import org.opengis.filter.FilterFactory;
028
029import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.OPTIONAL;
030import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
031import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
032
033
034/**
035 * Metadata about the specific elements that a particular implementation supports.
036 * A client application can inspect the filter capabilities metadata and be able
037 * to determine which operators and types a filter expression processor supports.
038 *
039 * @author  Torsten Friebe (lat/lon)
040 * @author  Markus Schneider (lat/lon)
041 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
042 * @version 3.1
043 * @since   3.1
044 */
045@UML(identifier="FilterCapabilities", specification=ISO_19143)
046public interface FilterCapabilities {
047    /**
048     * Declaration of which conformance classes a particular implementation supports.
049     *
050     * @return declaration of which conformance classes a particular implementation supports.
051     */
052    @UML(identifier="conformance", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
053    Conformance getConformance();
054
055    /**
056     * Provides a list of element names that represent the resource identifier elements that the service supports.
057     *
058     * @return capabilities used to convey supported identifier operators.
059     */
060    @UML(identifier="idCapabilities", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
061    default Optional<IdCapabilities> getIdCapabilities() {
062        return Optional.empty();
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Advertises which logical, comparison and arithmetic operators the service supports.
067     * If empty, then a client shall assume that the service does not support any logical
068     * or comparison operators and does not implement any additional functions.
069     *
070     * @return logical, comparison and arithmetic operators supported.
071     */
072    @UML(identifier="scalarCapabilities", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
073    default Optional<ScalarCapabilities> getScalarCapabilities() {
074        return Optional.empty();
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Advertises which spatial operators and geometric operands the service supports.
079     * If empty, a client shall assume that the service does not support any spatial operators.
080     *
081     * @return capabilities used to convey supported spatial operators.
082     */
083    @UML(identifier="spatialCapabilities", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
084    default Optional<SpatialCapabilities> getSpatialCapabilities() {
085        return Optional.empty();
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Advertises which temporal operators and temporal operands the service supports.
090     * If empty, a client shall assume that the service does not support any temporal operators.
091     *
092     * @return capabilities used to convey supported temporal operators.
093     */
094    @UML(identifier="temporalCapabilities", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
095    default Optional<TemporalCapabilities> getTemporalCapabilities() {
096        return Optional.empty();
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Enumerates the functions that may be used in filter expressions.
101     * Keys are function names that can be used in calls to {@link FilterFactory#function(String, Expression[])}.
102     * Associated values are descriptions of the functions.
103     *
104     * <h4>Invariants</h4>
105     * For each entry, the key should be equal to <code>{@linkplain AvailableFunction#getName()}.toString()</code>,
106     * optionally with the {@link LocalName} replaced by a {@link ScopedName} for string representation purposes.
107     *
108     * @return the functions that may be used in filter expressions.
109     *
110     * @see FilterFactory#function(String, Expression[])
111     */
112    @UML(identifier="functions", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
113    default Map<String, ? extends AvailableFunction> getFunctions() {
114        return Collections.emptyMap();
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Advertises any additional operators added to the filter syntax.
119     *
120     * @return additional operators added to the filter syntax.
121     */
122    @UML(identifier="extendedCapabilities", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
123    default Optional<ExtendedCapabilities> getExtendedCapabilities() {
124        return Optional.empty();
125    }
126}
